intro: [WRONG START] Hieracius nigrescens subsp. subrhaeticum, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is characterized by its basal rosette of dark green, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers in late summer. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in cool, moist environments. It has a fibrous root system and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions. This subspecies is part of the Asteraceae family, known for its composite flower heads and medicinal properties in some species.
